article.headline: Santa Clara 60, San Diego 56
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- Kevin Foster scored 21 points and Evan Roquemore added 12 to help Santa Clara overcome a 20-point second-half deficit and defeat San Diego 60-56 on Saturday night. Troy Payne snagged a double-double with 10 points and 10 rebounds as the Broncos (16-11, 6-4 West Coast) matched their biggest comeback in school history. Devin Ginty led the Toreros (5-21, 1-10) with 23 points, tying his career high set last week against Pepperdine. Chris Manresa grabbed a career-high 14 rebounds. Roquemore gave Santa Clara its first lead, 52-51, with a 3-pointer with 3:52 left. Ken Rancifer answered with a 3, putting San Diego on top 54-52. Another 3-pointer by Roquemore gave the Broncos a 58-56 lead with 40.5 seconds left. After San Diego's Cameron Miles missed a 3-pointer, Roquemore added two more points from the foul line for the final score.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
